data.title: Best Kept Secret in Des Moines Area!
data.text:
Our friends found this establishment based on its online ratings.  He made reservations on a Friday night, which was a good thing.  The place has very limited seating, and reservations were necessary.

Don't let the small size fool you.  The menu and execution match any kitchen of establishment many times its size.  We were satisfied appetizers and main courses, and every member of our party had a different item on our list to try next time we come back.

data.title: A Hidden Gem
data.text:
We visited Cooper's on 5th for the first time last night and were pleasantly surprised!  We  made a reservation for 4 and were happy that we did!  The restaurant is small but very cozy with warm lighting.  We were served by a very attentive waitress (I can't remember her name today.) She was very helpful and kept our table clean but didn't bother us as we visited.  
We started with two appetizers, the meat lovers egg rolls and bbq pork nachos.  Both were fantastic and full of flavor!  In our group we had the Tuscan chicken pasta, the port braised spare ribs with vegetables and garlic cheddar mashed potatoes as well as the pulled pork cuban with german potato salad.  We were all very impressed with our meals.  They were full of great flavor, beautiful in presentation and servings were large.  I can even add that the dinner salads that came with our meals were wonderful!  
Cooper's has a nice beverage menu as well.  I especially enjoyed the peach moscow mule!  
Don't miss Cooper's on 5th!  We will be back!

data.title: delightful small gourmet bar food
data.text: We really enjoyed Cooper's.  Went there after finding it on TripAdvisor because we were in West Des Moines and didn't want to do chain food.  What a pleasant surprise.  Huge servings.  Gourmet takes on classic foods.  Specializing in egg roll appetizers that are unique (the night we were there it was club egg roll and is just like it sounds, a club sandwich in the form of an eggroll).  Delicious.  The service was great.  I'm kind of a cheap tipper, but left 25% for the server which I never do.  This place is very small (maybe 30 or so seats), so call ahead for a reservation if you have a group.  Loved this place.

data.title: Wonderful First Time Visit!
data.text: Smaller restaurant in historic Valley Junction.  Lindsey was our waitress and what a sweetheart!  Very attentive and so friendly.  I enjoyed a wonderful chicken salad sandwich on toasted bread, coleslaw and deep fried zucchini.   All were wonderful!  My husband had the Meatloaf Meltdown--a large piece of meatloaf with grilled onions, sweet tomato glaze, white cheddar and American cheese served open face with coleslaw.  Very flavorful!  The dessert menu had a great variety and we chose the strawberry shortcake to share.  An old fashioned biscuit that was absolutely the best I have ever had!  Topped with fresh sliced strawberries, whipped cream, and served with a little pitcher of real cream!  Cannot describe how wonderful it was!  Reasonable prices, too.  Can't wait to go back!

data.title: Impromptu turned into huge fan!
data.text: We were shopping in valley junction and had time for lunch so we decided to stop into Coopers.  It's embarrassing to say I've lived here my whole life and have never been.  I will be a regular now!  The service is friendly and prompt, the atmosphere is fun and inviting.  We've have just about everything on the menu after several visits and I've never been disappointed.  They have fun specials every day including food and drink specials.  This is an awesome place for something casual, drinks or dinner.  Huge fan!

data.title: Great Food.
data.text: Food was terrific.  Two had salads, one a burger and one a nacho dish.  Service was outstanding and all of the food was fresh and tasty.  Fries were awesome.

data.title: Excelleny
data.text: We ate dinner at Cooper's this evening & the food & service was outstanding!  Crab & artichoke dip, meatloaf meltdown & bourbon burger were all very good.

data.title: Good burgers and service
data.text:
Interesting place in historic Valley Junction that appears like a dive bar but is a nice restaurant.  We went for lunch on a Saturday and they were not very busy which was nice.  However the bartender was also the waiter (Matt) and running around a lot.  He could have used a little help but at the same time, we never had to wait long for our food, refills, or any service.  Matt did a great job all on his own, he was very friendly with everyone that he was serving, not just us.  

Because we are so similar, we both order the junction burger and it was very good.  It came with wedge fries which I didn’t care for as much as my husband did.  The burger was done medium well and had good flavor.  The wedge fries we very thick but done all the way through.  $10 for a burger and fries is a little high but at the same time it was good and I will go back sometime.  Partly due to Matt being such a good server and making you feel so welcome.  

The lighting is very dark and it is almost too dark to read the menu and that is really the only bad thing could find about our visit so that is a good thing.  I recommend trying Coopers on 5th.

data.title: Love this little eatery
data.text:
Hmm...I could not agree less with DMSouthsider. To each his own i guess, but Cooper's has become a favorite lunch destination for my colleagues and myself. I'm envious that the folks who live around the Valley Junction area have this cozy, locally-owned, neighborhood eatery right around the corner.

The food is outstanding and the owner and staff are friendly, prompt and responsive. To be fair, we have not stopped by for dinner yet, but plan to do so soon. We know they are busy at night (for good reason) and so will plan ahead with a reservation when we go.

Wanting an out of this world burger? This is your place. Try the black and blue burger: tasty, homemade patty, fresh, tender bun, swiss, grilled onions and blue cheese spread. Mouth watering yet? Mine is. Time for a repeat!

data.title: Won't be disappointed!
data.text: My family stopped for lunch and we're so happy we did!  It is not an extensive menu but different choices.  A very reasonable lunch for 7 to 10 dollars.  I had an excellent soup and sandwich, one had the best burger they had for a long time, and another had the grown up grilled cheese!  I know they have great specials for evenings too.  Please stop!

data.title: Quite a nice little spot
data.text: My wife and I stopped in for lunch while we were in Valley Junction one Sunday afternoon. We had our one-year-old with us (they have highchairs). The lunch menu is simple but comprehensive and fairly inexpensive. The drink special on Sundays at least at this point was $3 mimosas, Bloody Mary's, and screwdrivers. I had a burger with fries and she had the grown-up grilled cheese, both were cooked well, arrived hot and tasted great. The place is on the small side but not crowded or uncomfortable, the decor has kind of a speakeasy throwback vibe. The Bloody Mary was excellent and had pickled asparagus in it and my wife enjoy the mimosa also. We had no issues with service or order screw-ups or anything like that. All in all we were happy and we will visit again.

data.title: Excellent food, very fun atmosphere
data.text: We were with locals who hadn't tried the place, and all of us ordered something different. Every one of us was happy with dinner. There was an extensive list of martinis and other drinks, and two of us ordered something new from that menu. The Key Lime martini was pronounced wonderful. We would definitely go back there.

data.title: Yummy
data.text: It's a small restaurant but the food was yummy....non-traditional burger and fries.  Not a great place for an intimate dinner.

data.title: Good stuff
data.text: An out of the ay location in West Des Moines Valley Junction area, Coopers has great food and is staffed by some fine people that make your time there worthwhile.

data.title: Eclectic
data.text: The place is very small so expect to wait during popular times. The food is worth it though! We have been there and was not disappointed.  Try the enroll of the day!

data.title: Mediocre food, service a little better
data.text:
My fiance and I wanted to try something new, so after checking reviews I thought Coopers might fit the bill. Unfortunately we were really disappointed, I am so confused by the reviews on here because the food was pretty lackluster, at best (though we waited 30 mins to be seated). Menu choices were not at all exciting so I settled on an appetizer of the pulled pork nachos and a cup of the veggie cheese soup, he got the bourbon bacon burger. The burger was cooked perfectly to temp (yay!) but all of the food was lacking flavor and was lukewarm. Service was fine, not bad or outstanding.

Didn't bother to take leftovers home. Won't be going back and would not recommend to others. If you want classy comfort food, I would MUCH more highly recommend Court Ave Brewing Co, for bar food in Valley Junction hit up The Longest Yard.

data.title: Lunch
data.text: Great quiet lunch, fantastic service. Be sure to try the egg roll of the day. Had half sandwich/salad combo. Turkey on jalapeño corn bread, delicious. Salad nice lettuces/ amount for house salad. Recommend!

data.title: Wish It Was Here
data.text: Cooper's is one of the restaurants that I wish would just pick up and move to the town we live in.  It has great food, an interesting menu with daily specials, and wonderful service.  It is a small and intimate venue with a relaxed atmosphere and a very attentive wait staff.  The have a nice selection of wines and generous well made cocktails. We visit West Des Moines frequently and have never been disappointed with Cooper's. Tip; make a reservation for dinner.

data.title: Very cute, first time going there. Worth a trip.
data.text: Thanks to Trip Advisor, I found them, and we decided to try it. There was 4 of us.  Very cute little restaurant.  Had the special egg rolls, they were Monte Cristo and really good.  Small size, a little café / diner type food, a little upscale from typical though. The hot german potato salad I loved, two of us loved it, one did not. It was very good. Meatloaf sandwich one person got, was very good also.  Drinks, beer available. A cute place to take parents or adult kids to for lunch or dinner, not to expensive, for four of us, with the egg roll appetizer and one bread pudding dessert, and 4 entrees, one beer, was around 75.00.  Josh was our server and it was great how he explained the egg rolls, the hot potato salad, he was an excellent server.  We are from out of town, but if we lived there we would definitely go a couple times a month. The dessert was excellent, could maybe of used a little more sauce, as usually the bread pudding is served with sauce poured over it also right before serving, it was not dry, it was very good, it would of just been excellent with a little more sauce on top.  Anyway, that's my viewpoint!

data.title: Hidden Gem!
data.text: While in Des Moines for the weekend we stumbled upon Coopers on 5th. What a hidden Gem! The food was amazing, especially the egg roll of the day. If you are in the area you should definitely give it a try!
